intro: Avenochloa laevigata, commonly known as smooth panicgrass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of a panicle made up of spikelets, which produce small, wind-pollinated flowers. Avenochloa laevigata is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
